meanings.definition: In the direction of the sun.
meanings.sent1: The flowers turned sunward to soak up the warmth.
meanings.sent2: She walked sunward, feeling the sun on her face.
meanings.sent3: The cat stretched lazily, arching sunward to bask in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The sunflowers leaned sunward, reaching for the bright rays above.
meanings.sent5: The bird flew sunward, following the path of the sun across the sky.

meanings.definition: Moving or facing toward the sun.
meanings.sent1: The sunward side of the house was bathed in golden light.
meanings.sent2: The sunward journey filled them with warmth and hope.
meanings.sent3: The sunward gaze of the child showed pure joy at the sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The sunward plants thrived in the sunny spot of the garden.
meanings.sent5: The sunward path led them to a beautiful sunset over the horizon.
